      static class  GenericCardGameCard.Value
      each enum has been given a value in brackets behind it this will allow us to compare their values later note: in some games the ACE will be low and this may have to be changed

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GenericCardGameCard(GenericCardGameCard.Value value, GenericCardGameCard.Suit suit)
      creates a simple card with a value, a suit, and two picture representations(back view/front view) retrieves the appropriate picture associated with the value and suit of the card

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int compareTo(GenericCardGameCard that)
      compares the ordinal values that were given to each card (TWO=2, ACE=14, etc)
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object other)
      checks to see if two cards are equal equals is used in the ArrayList contains function by implementing equals for each type of object it is possible to call ArrayList.contains(Card) and it will work
      void faceDown()
      sets the display of this card to FACEDOWN

      void setOwner(GenericCardGamePlayer owner)
      sets this owner
      java.lang.String toString()
      converts the card value and the suit value to a string value used for error handling and the ability to see what is happening inside the system

      • GenericCardGameCard

        public GenericCardGameCard(GenericCardGameCard.Value value,
                   GenericCardGameCard.Suit suit)
        creates a simple card with a value, a suit, and two picture representations(back view/front view) retrieves the appropriate picture associated with the value and suit of the card
        Parameters:
        value - the number associated with the card object
        suit - the suit associated with the card object
        Throws:
        generic - exception and prints the stackTrace so we can see what happened

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object other)
        checks to see if two cards are equal equals is used in the ArrayList contains function by implementing equals for each type of object it is possible to call ArrayList.contains(Card) and it will work
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        other - the card that we are comparing this card to

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(GenericCardGameCard that)
        compares the ordinal values that were given to each card (TWO=2, ACE=14, etc)
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<GenericCardGameCard>
        Returns:
        0 if two cards are equal, -1 if this card is less than the object it is compared to, otherwise return 1
